Openscapes Newsletter #8: Fall 2023

how-we-work
blog
Authors

Julie Lowndes

Stefanie Butland

Published

October 5, 2023

Welcome to Openscapes’ eighth newsletter! If you’re interested in seeing these infrequent updates in your inbox, please sign up here (linked from our get involved page). And! If you have signed up but did not see this in your inbox, please check your spam folder!

Happy Fall; it feels like it happened all of a sudden in Santa Barbara, California and Kamloops British Columbia. Ileana and Erin are both working on their quals; Eli has been in India teaching xx. This is a short update, first on events coming up this Fall and then sharing

Upcoming Fall events

A few events coming up this fall we hope to see you at:

  • Oct 5:
  • Oct 17
  • AGU:
  • NASA Openscapes: updating the mentors page with calendar and activities; grateful to be partnering and coworking with Yuvi Panda, Carl Boettiger, and Coiled.io, and others on cloud infrastructure
  • onboarding 3 groups: NASA, NOAA, Hutch

NASA Openscapes Cloud Support

  • R Cloud hackdays https://github.com/NASA-Openscapes/earthdata-cloud-cookbook/discussions/247#discussioncomment-7138029

  • Coiled

Other Spring and Summer Review

One of the themes that keeps coming up, particularly in this 2023 Year of Open Science is “showing up at other people’s parties”; and we’ve been grateful to (re)connect with colleagues virtually and in person at ESIP, Carpentries, Posit, Shannon D, CSCCE Tool Tips,

We’ve been able to slow down and catch up a bit over summer, following a busy spring that included the second NASA Openscapes Champions Cohort, we built a new Zenodo Openscapes Community to help find and cite Openscapes things, we migrated our website to Quarto, learned coaching skills that have made us better open data science mentors.

  • Carpentries Instructors training

We also launched two new programs that we will also lead annually: - Ileana Fenwick’s Pathway to Open Science - join us February 2024! - Reflections - join us May 2024!

Coming up this fall

Goals this year: stories & connecting to climate and daily

  • 2 publicatinos & submitted
  • ESIP in person
  • new website
  • Launched 2 programs: Pathways and Reflections in Spring. Both upcoming in 2024!! Look for signups
  • Champs NASA
